page.title: 02Dinas Powys/Wenvoe Economy
page.content: This rural area, to the south-west of Cardiff, features two main villages: Dinas Powys (or Dinas Powis) and Wenvoe. In earlier times, limestone quarrying and lime-burning were important local activities. Today, though, it is an area of small farms concerned mainly with dairying and some beef, interspersed with tracts of pleasant woodland. Market gardening and horticulture are also of local significance. In addition to the two villages mentioned, there are also smaller pleasantly-situated settlements, some with interesting churches of historical and architectural interest.
